result.rationale: Poecilobothrus majesticus has not been recorded for over 100 years. It is therefore considered Extinct. This assessment was produced using information provided by Martin Drake and Alan Stubbs.
result.geographicrange: The only reported occurrence of this species is from Walton-on-the-Naze, Essex, England in 1907. In the absence of other records for over 100 years this species is now thought to be Extinct.
result.population: The population of this species is now considered Extinct.
result.habitat: The habitat of this species is unknown, however, it may be saltmarsh.
result.threats: The cause of the extinction of this species is unknown.
result.conservationmeasures: There are no conservation actions planned for this species.
